subject: Boxing
lead_paragraph: The flyweight Rau’shee Warren and the welterweight Demetrius Andrade became the first Americans in eight years to win gold medals at the World Boxing Championships with convincing victories in the finals yesterday in Chicago. Warren beat Thailand’s Somjit Jongjohor, 13-9, despite having two front teeth knocked out. Andrade’s bout with Thailand’s Non Boonjumnong was stopped in the second round because of an injury to Boonjumnong’s right arm.
